metadata.Title: CVE-2022-42930 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
If two Workers were simultaneously initializing their CacheStorage, a datarace could have occurred in the `ThirdPartyUtil` component. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 106.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42930` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 106.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 106.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 106.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '106.0.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
